titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Publications FA767

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-19 00:54:18 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Publications

physdesc.extent: 45 manuscript boxes, 4 standard record storage cartons

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All published material is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.
Completion of a use agreement is required prior to providing scholarly access. See RAC Head of Reference (or applicable designee) for details.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Advanced processing by Lucas Buresch, RAC Archivist, 2015. Additions transferred to the archival collection from the RAC Library processed in 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Ford Foundation publication such as the Ford Foundation Letter and the Ford Foundation report, other published reports, and conference papers.

relatedmaterial.p: Ford Foundation records, Publications (Non-Grant Related), Accessions 2017:079 and 2017:089 (FA1394) http://dimes.rockarch.org/FA1394/collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes "In Memoriam, Kermit Gordon?", Bibliography of McGeorge Bundy publications, "In Praise of Candor", "To Cap the Volcano", "Were Those The Days?", "The Presidency and the Peace", "The Art of Giving", "The End of Either/Or", "The Blessing that is Federal Aid", "Serving the Earth", "The Moral and Social Responsibilities of the Trustees of Foundations", "Faculty Power".

did.unittitle: Robert Schrank - Various articles, essays, publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes "Two women, three men on a raft", in the "Harvard Business Review" (1975 May-June); "First, Get Good Data on Youth Joblessness" (1980); "For a Worker-Exchange Program" (1973); "Are unions an anachronism?", in the "Harvard Business Review (1979); "Worker morale: Are there solutions abroad?" (1979); "Horse-collar, blue-collar blues", in the Harvard Business Review (1981 May-June).
